meanings.definition: To arrange in proper order or formation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher marshaled the students into a straight line for the fire drill.
meanings.sent2: The librarian marshaled the books on the shelf according to their genres.
meanings.sent3: The toys in the playroom marshaled themselves into a neat row when the children left.
meanings.sent4: The ants marshaled their forces to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The conductor marshaled the musicians into a harmonious orchestra.

meanings.definition: To lead or direct in a coordinated way.
meanings.sent1: The coach marshaled the players on the field for the final game.
meanings.sent2: The general marshaled the troops into battle formation.
meanings.sent3: The traffic officer marshaled the cars through the busy intersection with ease.
meanings.sent4: The captain marshaled his crew to navigate through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher marshaled the students' attention towards the whiteboard.

meanings.definition: To gather or assemble for a purpose.
meanings.sent1: The volunteers marshaled at the park to clean up the litter.
meanings.sent2: The protesters marshaled outside the government building to demand change.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients marshaled on the kitchen counter for the baking project.
meanings.sent4: The team marshaled their resources to tackle the challenging project ahead.
meanings.sent5: The family marshaled their strength to support their loved one during a difficult time.
